intro: Cassia loretensis, commonly known as the Loretto cassia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Cassia loretensis thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks.
